post.content:
Here is for sure a bug, now now not a impartial

Here I believed the Borderlands games hang been the single ones that would per chance maybe chuck frigid loot at you at the same time as you hit clumps of filth and rock, nonetheless it looks Murderer’s Creed Valhalla has something to veil in its rock piles too. Over the weekend, Valhalla gamers managed to procure a secret Isu bow by regularly whacking a somewhat unassuming pile of rocks – nonetheless, this positively is now now not the formulation you are supposed to procure it.

On this video, YouTuber “JorRaptor” walks thru the diagram all of it works (thanks, Kotaku). First, you’ll need Eivor to shuttle waaay up north to Eurvicscire, and procure the actual rock pile near a lake.

These sorts of rock piles in total fracture at the same time as you hit them, shedding iron ore. The queer factor about this one even supposing, is that it doesn’t ruin. Relieve whacking it, set up and reload, then whack it some more nonetheless, and in the fracture the legendary bow, Noden’s Arc, will seem on your stock.

Or now now not it is a weapon made the Isu, an old model civilisation in Murderer’s Creed lore that predates humans. They hang been in most cases gods, and likewise construct of aliens, so as that’s frigid. The bow is all somewhat and glowy, right here’s a apt screenshot taken by Reddit individual “inxcognito”:

Sadly, finding this weapon by beating up rocks looks to be a bug, somewhat than a impartial.

“Here’s a realistic brute force hack, now now not the ‘honest real’ formulation to salvage this bow,” Valhalla’s anecdote director Darby McDevitt tweeted. “There may be an ‘in world’ formulation to enact it. Nonetheless I reveal this works for an Any% Speedrun.”

He adds that the legit formulation to salvage the bow “entails a few steps that I haven’t viewed folks attempt but”, nonetheless he doesn’t teach precisely what these steps are. Or now now not it is fine to listen to the game accrued has some unsolved mysteries a accurate few months after begin, it makes me wanna dive aid in and attain some detective work (even supposing, it also makes me wanna spend the bow the rock-whacking formulation sooner than it be patched out).

Talking of the old normal civilisation, Murderer’s Creed Valhalla gamers currently managed to translate the fictional Isu language too. I ponder what somewhat a few queer and reliable secrets these god-aliens hang hidden.
